taxon_identification.name_authority_date: Eragrostis pilosa (L.) P. Beauv. var. pilosa

bio:treatment.description: Culms with few or no glandular pits; sheaths and blades without glandular pits. Spikelets 0.6-1.3 mm wide. Upper glumes 0.7-1.2 mm; lemmas 1.2-1.8 mm; caryopses 0.5-0.9 mm.
bio:treatment.discussion: Eragrostis pilosa var. pilosa is more common than E. pilosa var. perplexa in the Flora region. Most of the records shown on the map are for this variety.
